text: Enables you to quickly setup fast and efficient instancing.  Any Questions, recommendations or bugs, email Oliver Hotz @ oliver@heimlich.net.
Instance by Attribute allows you to quickly randomly instance multiple objects across points.

If a @variant integer attribute is present on the points being fed into the HDA, it will use that attribute to define the variation.  The variant ID is 0 for the first object, 1 for the second, and son on.
If no incoming @variant attributes exist, you can change the seed for the randomization.
Defines how many Objects are used as sources.  Each source will get their corresponding ID.  (Object one  → @variant = 0, Object two  → @variant = 1)
When enabled, will display the instances in OpenGL as the chosen mode instead of just points.

Full - Displays full Geometry
    Bounding Box - Displays the bounding box as solid
    Bounding Box Wireframe - Displays the bounding box as wireframe
    PolyReduce - Allows you to reduce the geometry to instance (OpenGL Only)
The name of the instance attribute.
Octane requires the instance attribute output to be named
, which is the default.  Other renders might use a different attribute name such as

title: OD Instance By Attribute
summary: Enables you to quickly setup fast and efficient instancing.  Any Questions, recommendations or bugs, email Oliver Hotz @ oliver@heimlich.net.
